docs.abstract: In 2018, hefty fiscal stimulus has buoyed the markets and helped America shrug off risks. That safeguard looks set to be weakened next year.
docs.snippet: In 2018, hefty fiscal stimulus has buoyed the markets and helped America shrug off risks. That safeguard looks set to be weakened next year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Wednesday. The briefing will be taking a break on Thursday and Friday, but look out for a special China-focused edition on Sunday. (Want this by email? Sign up here.)

headline.main: DealBook Briefing: The Stock Rout Is a Warning About the Economy

docs.abstract: The company’s bonds fell sharply this week, which, along with rising interest rates and slowing growth, should raise red flags for credit investors.
docs.snippet: The company’s bonds fell sharply this week, which, along with rising interest rates and slowing growth, should raise red flags for credit investors.

docs.abstract: The police outside New Delhi raided fake tech-support centers that sent false warnings to Americans and Canadians and then charged to “fix” the nonexistent infection.
docs.snippet: The police outside New Delhi raided fake tech-support centers that sent false warnings to Americans and Canadians and then charged to “fix” the nonexistent infection.
docs.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — You know the messages. They pop up on your computer screen with ominous warnings like, “Your computer has been infected with a virus. Call our toll-free number immediately for help.”

headline.main: That Virus Alert on Your Computer? Scammers in India May Be Behind It
headline.print_headline: That Fake Virus Alert And Its $1,000 ‘Repair’ May Come From India

byline.original: By Vindu Goel and Suhasini Raj

docs.abstract: A group of Silicon Valley executives went to China and discovered a parallel tech universe that can be equally impressive, alienating and dystopian.
docs.snippet: A group of Silicon Valley executives went to China and discovered a parallel tech universe that can be equally impressive, alienating and dystopian.
docs.lead_paragraph: One Chinese technology executive said he worked 14 to 15 hours a day at least six days a week. Another said he worked every waking hour and forced himself to watch movies to relax.

headline.main: Crazy Work Hours and Lots of Cameras: Silicon Valley Goes to China
headline.print_headline: Crazy Work Hours and Lots of Cameras: Silicon Valley Goes to China

docs.abstract: Shao Chunyou rose from the assembly line to the boss’s office. Now the old recipes for success don’t work, and he must reinvent himself again.
docs.snippet: Shao Chunyou rose from the assembly line to the boss’s office. Now the old recipes for success don’t work, and he must reinvent himself again.
docs.lead_paragraph: Shao Chunyou exemplifies the Chinese dream. Over three decades, he rose from an assembly line worker to an electronics business owner, following China’s rise from an economic backwater to the world’s No. 2 economy. He now owns two factories and employs over 2,000 workers.

headline.main: China Transforms, and a Factory Owner Struggles to Follow
headline.print_headline: Struggle. Rise. Win. Now, Do It All Again.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Dongguan Quankang Electronics Technology Co Ltd

docs.abstract: Many business figures join the organization out of expedience. Likewise, the party sees benefits in associating itself with capitalist success stories.
docs.snippet: Many business figures join the organization out of expedience. Likewise, the party sees benefits in associating itself with capitalist success stories.
docs.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Jack Ma, China’s richest man and the guiding force behind its biggest e-commerce company, belongs to an elite club of power brokers, 89 million strong: the Chinese Communist Party.

headline.main: Jack Ma, China’s Richest Man, Belongs to the Communist Party. Of Course.
headline.print_headline: In China, Billionaires Sidle Up to the Party

docs.abstract: The consulting company settled with the Justice Department unit that oversees the bankruptcy system. But the creditor allegations that led to the settlement are still before a judge.
docs.snippet: The consulting company settled with the Justice Department unit that oversees the bankruptcy system. But the creditor allegations that led to the settlement are still before a judge.
docs.lead_paragraph: McKinsey & Company agreed Tuesday to a $15 million settlement with the Justice Department to resolve an investigation into allegations that it did not make required disclosures of its financial connections with other parties while working on bankruptcies.

headline.main: McKinsey Will Return $15 Million in Fees Over Disclosure Failures

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the United States Trustee

docs.abstract: A request to force the return of about $20 million in fees involves a coal company bankruptcy in which McKinsey was both an adviser and a creditor.
docs.snippet: A request to force the return of about $20 million in fees involves a coal company bankruptcy in which McKinsey was both an adviser and a creditor.
docs.lead_paragraph: The global consulting firm McKinsey and Company faced claims on Friday that it had failed to disclose the dual roles it was playing in three bankruptcy cases, potential violations of federal requirements meant to prevent an undisclosed conflict of interest from tainting the outcomes.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Says McKinsey Hid Dual Roles to Profit From Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: McKinsey Hid Its Roles In 3 Bankruptcy Cases, Justice Dept. Charges

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the United States Trustee

docs.abstract: Mr. Modi, whose diamonds have adorned Hollywood stars, has been accused of a major bank fraud in India.
docs.snippet: Mr. Modi, whose diamonds have adorned Hollywood stars, has been accused of a major bank fraud in India.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Nirav Modi, whose opulent necklaces have been worn by A-list celebrities, was in custody in London after being denied bail following his arrest this week in a bank fraud in India totaling nearly $3 billion.

headline.main: Nirav Modi, Fugitive ‘Jeweler to the Stars,’ Is Arrested in London
headline.print_headline: Indian Jewelry Designer Is Arrested in London

byline.original: By Amie Tsang and Kai Schultz

docs.abstract: Prosecutors in Germany connected the charges against Martin Winterkorn and four other managers to events that ran from 2006, when the diesel scandal was first conceived, to 2015.
docs.snippet: Prosecutors in Germany connected the charges against Martin Winterkorn and four other managers to events that ran from 2006, when the diesel scandal was first conceived, to 2015.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — German prosecutors on Monday filed aggravated fraud charges against Martin Winterkorn, the former chief executive of Volkswagen who led the company when it deceived regulators about its vehicles’ diesel exhaust levels.

headline.main: Former VW C.E.O. Martin Winterkorn Is Charged by Germany in Diesel Scheme
headline.print_headline: Ex-VW Chief Is Charged  By Germany
